Summary: 5 inch diameter spinning, hovering silver egg/disk
divs: sighting detailssitting down for lunch around midday. a sandwich and a glass of fruit juice. looking out the picture window to the back field, when i noticed a hovering object about 5 inches across. it was approzimately seventy five feet away and hovering about 4 feet off the ground, appeared like a spinning silver egg. at first i didn't pay it to much attention thinking it was an eastern phoebe, a type of flycatcher that is common in the area. the phoebe's are a joy to watch as they leave there perch on a limb and fly out a few feet and hover to catch insects on the wing. anyway, i soon noticed that the object was not a bird and i watched it spin like an egg, when it started to change shape and color. slowly it changed from the spinning egg wobble to a disk of the same size and it appeared that it had dark markings or windows around it that created a grey band against the reflective silver, as it was spinning quite fast. as i watched it for about 4 minutes it began to slowly rise above the 4 foot elevation, ever so slowly but with an acceleration so that as it moved incrementally higher it moved ever faster until it reached about 15 feet above the ground and it dissappeared. my assumption is that it continued in the straight vertical direction of it's original trajectory and simply moved so fast as to disappear in the blink of an eye. my first thought after it disappeared was that i should have waved hello. i didn't tell anyone for a few months, because i have no proof and wondered what people would think of me. the thing is: i know i saw it, i know it was real and not an apparition. as i watched it, i studied it for explanation against all my experience and it remained as it was; a hovering, spinning silver egg\disk about 5 inches across and 3 inches high, 4 feet above a mowed grass field, 15 feet in front of an evergreen cedar tree. i had a peaceful feeling after it left, a feeling that i was lucky to see such an unusual thing, a thing that really exists, but of which i have no explanation of it's origin. months later upon telling a close friend of the siting, he said he thought it was "one of ours" a "military drone or probe". i don't think anyone can know what it was. it was unique. it was real. i saw it.
